smell_analysis.justification: All pages in the PDF contain visible diagram elements; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the provided use case diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are connected to actors, either directly or via <<include>> relationships to use cases that are connected to actors.
No actors have multiple associated use cases with synonymous names (e.g., 'Add' and 'Register' for the same entity) in the use case diagrams.
The package diagram (Page 1) does not contain multiple elements with the same name within the same package.

No obvious redundant data columns were found in unconnected tables. While 'nimetus' appears in multiple tables (e.g., Auto, Auto_mark), these tables are connected via foreign keys, or the column represents a distinct attribute for that specific entity.
Use cases consistently use the Verb-Noun format (e.g., 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Registreeri auto', 'Tuvasta kasutaja').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, LÃµpetatud, Unustatud) are reachable from the Start state.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions are reachable through the logical flow.
All visible relationships in the class and data model diagrams include multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*).
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements (classes, tables, use cases, or states). The largest diagrams (e.g., Page 15) contain 9 tables.
No class or table was found with 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 5 connections for the 'Auto' class on Page 12.
The layout of elements in all diagrams is relatively balanced, with no related elements placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali', 'Registreeri').
The attribute 'vin' in the 'Auto' class (visible on Pages 11, 12, 17, 18) has a name consisting of exactly 3 characters, violating the rule '3 or less characters'.
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Riik').
All attribute/column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'reg_aeg').
Table names in the data models are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
No improper prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found. Prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK' found in the models are explicitly allowed by the rule.
